txt.en: 'Oh, tell us just a little more! Won't you, [placeholder]?'
'You say that Skorgrím means to deceive us? Whatever you are... you are no Dourhand, [placeholder]!'
'Agh!'
Instance: The Shadow of Mordor
'If Lord Skorgrím believes Angmar is our ally, then it must be so!'
'What are you saying? The Longbeards must answer for their treachery!'
'Don't you look at me like that, shakglob....'
'Is that... Ashaug? Maybe he knows what happened....'
'I don't like the look of this, [placeholder]....'
'Too many dead... and too quiet.'
'The Black One hurts us, Orcses hurts us and now nassty dwarfses?'
'Look there! One of their captains fell in the fighting....'
'...and if that armour fits, we might have found our way out!'
'Go on, [placeholder]. Put it on!'
'But if we cross paths with that thing again... I say we keep our distance!'
'[placeholder] has told us enough for one night, I think.'
'If we don't want to end up like them, we'd ought to find some weapons... and fast!'
'Besides, we've got our orders from Gormr. There'll be time enough for stories tomorrow.'
'Follow me, [placeholder].'
'TBD'
'What's this, then? Some sort of pale Orc? I've never seen anything like it.'
'Come on, [placeholder]!'
'Skorgrím-king?! But you... you are dead!'
'Come, dwarf.'
'Run, [placeholder]! We'll find you!'
'Watch your footing, [placeholder]. It's a long way down....'
'You have lain in state since Steward Gormr found you in the Silver Deep!'
'How do you walk among us once more?'
'Not if we hurts them first, Preciouss....'
'Ach! Leave uss alone! *gollum*, *gollum*....'
'I can handle myself, [placeholder]. Let Dwalin answer for what has happened!'
'TBD'
'Dourhands!'
'I wonder what's keeping Bjarni....'
'It is by the hand of Ivar and the sacrifice of your Steward that I live once more.'
'A chill wind blows. Do you feel it?'
'But I do not come bearing glad tidings... for we have been betrayed!'
'That is not necessary.'
'The Longbeards massacred our people during the Ritual of Commemoration...'
'I fled from the Dark Tower...'
'...and their treachery stains my tomb with Dourhand blood.'
'I did not look back. I could not.'
'But hope is not lost!'
'As you command, Lord Skorgrím!'
'I travelled through many unfamiliar lands, but Mordor never seemed far enough behind.'
'I have been promised an audience with the Witch-king of Angmar.'
'Ugh... what was that thing?'
'But here, among the Blue Mountains, my heart is free of dread.'
'Angmar shall prove a mighty ally, and we Dourhands will avenge this tragedy...
'...and reclaim what was taken from us!'
'It is time to make your choice.'
'Something troubles me about Skorgrím's words, [placeholder]. I wish to trust them, but I can't.'
'Will you remain here and await your doom or...'
'It is a long way to Thorin's Hall, but I will guide us.'
'Will you follow me and seek for new glory?'
'Nar! It'll be the Pits for all three of you!'
'Hearken to me, Dourhands, and all shall be revealed.'
The pale creature springs to its feet!
'Over here!'
'Bah, fine!'
'Break's over, I guess....'
'Let's have a look at you....'
'Go on. I'll keep watch!'
'Be not afraid!'
'Now, now. It's no good to hear the whole story at once, is it?'
'Oh come on, Nagli! We haven't even heard the half of it!'
'Ah-ha! This'll do....'
'Baruk... khazâd! Imrîdi zabad-dush!'
'Aye, it's quite a long way from Mordor to the Blue Mountains....'
'Skorgrím's return was foretold by the Steward. I must honour Gormr's will!'
